intro: Achras pruniformis, commonly known as the cannonball tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters at the base of the tree. The fruit is a large, spiky capsule that splits open to reveal bright red seeds. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and has thick, rough bark. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
